title: L'Orval NV Chasan Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Rather rustic flavors, but there is some green fruit and a hint of cream.This Tetrapak-packed wine has a full-bodied texture, with only light acidity.
title: French Rabbit 2005 Chardonnay Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Way too much wood, all toast, spice and green wood.
title: René Michel et Fils 2008 Cray  (Viré-Clessé)

description: It's hard to find any noticeable fruit on the nose, and there isn't much more in the mouth, except for a smidgen of citrus and green apple. It finishes mild and short. --M.S.
title: Fortant 1999 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Lacking intensity, the nose exhibits mild notes of ripe red apple while the palate adds a touch of canteloupe. Fat and round with a fleeting finish, the wine never really makes a strong impression.
title: Fortant 2005 Kosher Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Melon and peach aromas start out fine but lose clarity. Citrus flavors that aren't quite full precede mild lemon and banana on the tail end. Nondescript and turns hot at the end. Kosher.
title: Abarbanel 2001 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Vin de Pays de L'Aude)

description: This is bitter, with hints of sulfur, yeast and almond. It's soft in texture and lacking fruit.
title: Manuel Seguin 2010  Bourgogne

description: Artificial perfumes, the wine tastes more like fruit candy.
title: Dominique Cornin 2008 Serreudiéres  (Mâcon-Chânes)

description: Asparagus aromas, a wine that has lost fruit, gained vegetable characters, not very pleasant.
title: Domaine des Chazelles 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: There are sweet vanilla aromas, along with aromas of green plums. This is a soft, creamy wine, with just a touch of greeness, and a full, creamy texture.
title: Barton & Guestier 2002 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Medium-full in the mouth, the wine has toasty oak and stone fruit flavors, and a short- to medium-length, stony-mineral finish. A faux-butter note (akin to the smell of movie-popcorn butter) dominates the palate after a few minutes of aeration.
title: Fortant 2000 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Slightly nutty and plywoody on the nose, partially redeemed by a plump mouthfeel. Flavors tend toward unripe pear and grapefruit.
title: Domaine de L'Olivier 2003 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Sweet, light and floral, but not fruity. Lemon and orange flavors yield to a zesty finish. Simple and very high in acidity.
title: Mommessin 2002 Nid D'Abeille Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A rustic wine, with earthy, tree-bark aromas and lean, sparse flavors that just barely veer into grapefruit. Very dry and acidic; it puckers the palate. Lean and tart. Will satisfy those who like this kind of wine, but doesn't have much to do with Chardonnay. Kosher.
subregion: Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France
title: Herzog Selection 1998 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France)

description: A thick, gluey wine with the most curious texture, very soft and flaccid. Low in acidity, with Chardonnay flavors of apples. Not much to recommend this clumsy wine.
title: Cave de Lugny 2001 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: Lemony, light and simple, with a hint of butterscotch on the nose.
title: Maison Jaffelin 2001  Mâcon-Villages

description: There's a cheesy underlay to the nose of this wine, with more pleasant and pronounced scents of toasted apple and bruised citrus upfront. The medium-weight palate is round and soft, with low acidity and a short finish.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 Pyréne L'inarrêtable Le Blanc Beurré Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: The wine is well made, with some attractive spicy wood. But the fruit is less exciting. A soft, smooth but anonymous style.
title: Lulu B. 2005 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: No lack of weight here, but the heaviness isn't well balanced by big fruit or crisp acids. Instead you get modest pear and peach flavors and a short finish.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2003 Classic Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Has earthy, lemony aromas, with a faux-oak and vanilla note. Drinks ripely fruity and a little sweet, and finishes slightly sweet. On the simple side.
title: Vichon 1997 Mediterranean Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Made in quite a ripe style, with caramel and poached pear aromas that carry through to the slightly watery palate. Lemon, pear and mineral notes show through on the short but flavorful finish. Drink up.
title: Labouré-Roi 2006 Petit Bistro Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: The nose brings to mind a caramel-coated apple and leads to a fairly simple but pleasant, lemon-infused palate with a crisp finish. Undertones of straw make us suspect this wine would have been better if released sooner.
title: Red Bicyclette 2005 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Candied and floral, with strong aromas of pear nectar and a dull, disjointed finish.
title: Lamblin & Fils 2001  Chablis

description: Thin and dilute, with soft fruit and a light white fruit character. Screwcap.
title: Cave de Lugny 2008  Mâcon-Villages

description: A soft, open wine that tastes dilute but at least finishes cleanly. There are many better, more characterful, basic white Burgundies on the market.
title: Michel Picard 2007  Bourgogne

description: This earthy Chardonnay from a limestone plot has more to do with texture and tight acidity than fruit. It presents a sharp, too-crisp edge.
title: Gérard Charvet 2014 La Réserve d'Amélie  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: The wine is too rich, losing sight of the fruit. It is so soft, lightly spicy and feels heavy.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: A disappointingly thin wine, very light. It's fresh enough, and there is a pleasing touch of citrus, but its aftertaste is somewhat dilute.
title: Moillard 2005 Domaine Greffes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Lemon-jelly aromas give this a strange character. The fruit reflects the same artificial flavor. It is hard to see where it is going.
title: Pierre Chardigny 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Véran)

description: Part of the range of negociant wines under the worldwide Xavier Flouret range, this Chablis is earthy, rustic, a soft but underwhelming wine, missing the proper bite of the region's wines. Imported by Cognac One, LLC.
title: Xavier Flouret 2006 Marly  (Chablis)

description: A candy-flavored wine, this is soft and missing acidity. Some spiced apple flavors are masked by the sherbet flavor.
title: Manciat-Poncet 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This is a yeasty wine that shows a bitter almond character. It has an unattractive hard edge.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2010  Chablis

description: Somewhat rustic, hard edged, not much pleasure here.
title: Louis Latour 2008  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Nutty and toasty, but even those notes are muted and modest. Not much going on here--a real disappointment from a big name in Burgundy. RETASTE
title: Dujac Fils & Pere 2001  Meursault

description: Soft and without much texture, way too open. Wood, spice and little fruit.
title: Domaine Ferret 2008 Les Perriéres Tête de Cru  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is light, fresh and fruity, just hinting at yellow fruits and with a sweet aftertaste. Drink immediately.
title: Belle Made For You NV Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Rather dull by New World standards, with earth and peach flavors and lots of oak. Feels heavy and soft in the mouth.
title: Barton & Guestier 2002 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Has some attractive fruit cocktail and floral aromas and flavors that turn tart and tangy on the finish. But there's also a hint of Play-doh that detracts from the overall impression.
title: Lamblin & Fils 2001 Bourgonge Blanc  (Bourgogne)

description: Light, sunny, golden raisin and talcum powder aromas open onto preface a palate rife with oak and citrus flavors, and a minerally mouthfeel. Finishes with almond and chalk. Would have been better without the slight but persistent twinge of greenness that begins in the mouth and lasts through the finish.
title: La Baume 1999 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Starts off with apple, talc and toasty aromas, but quickly takes on aromas of ripe bananas. Banana flavors also dominate the palate; a slight minerally overlay keeps the Chard from being too tropical. Finishes medium-long, with toast and apple notes.
title: Maison Nicolas 2000 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: An almost Sauvignon Blanc-like palate of light lemon and mineral flavors melts into more citrus, plus green herbs and vegetables, on the finish. Lots of vanilla, plus a perfumey-floral sweetness, marks the bouquet.
subregion: Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France
title: Mont Saint-Vincent 2000 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France)

description: There's a graphite-like, mineral edge to this wine's green apple and lemon flavors, but it lacks depth and finishes short.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2001  Mâcon-Villages

description: Has buttery, baked-apple aromas, but lacks that same sense of richness on the palate, with tart apple and lemon flavors following. Citrusy and fresh on the finish. Imported by Cannon Wines Limited.
title: Patriarche Pére et Fils 2003 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Decently made but modest Chardonnay, with melon flavors that turn tart and earthy, veering toward grapefruit on the finish.
title: Mommessin 2003 Nid D'Abeille Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: This light, gently fruity wine has a soft, candied pear and apple flavor that is open, immediately accessible. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Patriarche Pére et Fils 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: From a warm area of France-the hefty body and overt sweetness virtually announce "Pays d'Oc white." Melon and lemon notes spread across the chewy palate. A heavy dose of candy-store sugar is partially balanced by a brisk tang on the finish.
title: Georges Duboeuf 1999 Milenage Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Not terribly complex but certainly very approachable and easy to drink. Good acidity and medium weight play well with the flavors of orange and apple in the mouth.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2008 Val De L'Ours Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Shows some pleasant pear and pineapple aromas before easing into flavors of pear, quince and anise. It's only medium in body, but shows a flush of warmth on the finish. Drink now.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2007 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Tired, and acquiring a smoky, petrolly note to show for it. There's still some lemon and green apple flavors at the core, finishing with juicy acidity.
title: F. Chauvenet 2000 Les Jumelles  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: A soft, lightly fruity wine, this is light in texture and flavor, with the merest hints of citrus fruits, apples and tangy orange. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Honeyed apples, creamed pears and pressed buttercups lead the nose of this value white. Flavors of mealy apple and melon unfold on the flat palate, which is low in acid and finished fast.
title: Arrogant Frog 2016 Lily Pad White Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: Lots of oak on the nose, and for that matter, throughout. The wine tastes of lemon, vanilla and wood resin, while the creamy finish deals even more oak. Texture and richness are not a problem, but the wood runs roughshod over the mild, base-level fruit.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2001 Cuvée Prestige Reserve Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Notes of cream, lemon and newly sawn wood open this full-bodied example from one of the brands that helped launch the popularity of Pays d'Oc varietal wines. The lush palate shows some lemon and pear notes with just a hint of mineral on the finish. Drink up.
title: Les Jamelles 2006 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A simple, clean and fresh Chardonnay, round and fruity, with some vanilla, spice and white peach fruit flavors. The aftertaste is soft, slightly sweet.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006 Bistro Wine Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: This wine is a blend of Chardonnay from different regions of France. It is light, fresh and clean, with some attractive white fruit flavors, lifted by some crisp acidity.
subregion: Vin de Pays Vignobles de France
title: Domaine de Virginie 2007 When Cédric met Cécile Chardonnay Chardonnay (Vin de Pays Vignobles de France)

description: Nutty at first, but some peach and apple fruit pokes through on the nose and then ad some earthy spice notes in the mouth. Seems a bit heavy--undoubtedly a victim of the abnormally hot vintage.
title: Patriarche Pére et Fils 2003  Bourgogne

description: Lively and vibrant, bright scents of apple and fresh orange supremes quickly fade on the light-weight palate and on the clean but short finish.
title: Les Jamelles 2010 Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: Despite pleasant aromas of apple tinged with cinnamon, vanilla and honey, the palate is hard, with grapefruit and sour apple flavors. Imported by Click Wine Group.
title: Thierry & Guy 2003 Fat Bastard Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: The fruit here is soft and rounded, with pleasant green and white fruits. It has some richness, but the acidity is unbalanced, giving too much green. The cool year may be to blame.
subregion: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire
title: Remy-Pannier 2007 Vallée des Jardins Chardonnay (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)

description: This is very soft and lacking in definition, with a light texture. However, it does have a crisp apple flavor and a line of acidity that gives freshness.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011  Mâcon-Villages

description: This light-bodied wine shows citrus and green fruit touches. It has a soft aftertaste that makes it attractive and ready to drink.
title: Tussock Jumper 2016 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This wine is textured, tight and seems to be missing out on fruit. It has pepper, spice and just a few hints of green plums. There is a bitter aftertaste.
title: L'original French Kiss 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This lightly toasty, vanilla-flavored wine shows good, light, tropical flavors. It opens well, with green plums and ripe fruit.
title: Fat Bastard 2005 Chardonnay Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Full, perhaps too soft wine, the flavors lost in a rather dilute character.
title: Catherine et Didier Tripoz 2008 Clos des Tournons  (Mâcon-Charnay)

description: Fat, ripe wine, showing some wood, with an edge of sweet acidity.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Domaine des Chenevriéres  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: The wine with a Polynesian family history is full of tropical fruit flavors, includig mango and pineapple, and only light acidity. It's a curious wine, slightly oxidized, grassy and super-ripe at the same time. Drink now.
title: Château Saint-Sernin 2014 Varua Maohi Domaine de Saint-Sernin Chardonnay (Cotes du Lot)

description: Light and lean, with aromas of grapefruit pith giving way to flavors of grapefruit and pineapple. Finishes on a slightly bitter note that might make it just fine with cassis in a kir.
title: La Chablisienne 2004  Bourgogne

description: The aromas of Asian pears, honey and dried spices are nice enough, as are the flavors of white-fleshed fruit and gumdrops, but the wine is a bit heavy and thick-textured, without a lot of verve to spice it up.
title: La Chablisienne 2001  Chablis

description: Soft, rounded and fruity, with apple flavors, this is pretty anonymous in character. Drink now.
designation: Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly
title: Eric Louis 2016 Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: There's a slight overripeness to the red apple scents in the bouquet, while the medium-weight palate falls a bit flat on the astringent, pithy finish. Drink now.
title: Bourgeois Family 2010 Cuvée Stéphi Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: While the wine is fresh, it also has a bitter, cheesy character that is more funky than fruity. The acidity is very present, giving a crisp edge. Drink now.
title: Domaine Pral 2014 Les Pays de Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: The wine is so soft, with a fruit-candy flavor as well as lemon sherbet and some attractive touches of acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Patriarche Pére et Fils 2015  Bourgogne

description: Fruity, ripe and round, this is simple Chardonnay that gives pleasure from its warm texture and softness. The apple flavor leads to a gentle finish.
title: Lupé-Cholet 2010  Bourgogne

description: Soft and simple, this has a pear flavor, a touch of vanilla and a creamy texture, plus crisp, lemon-zest-like acidity on the finish. Drink this now.
title: Domaine Luquet 2011 Les Mulots  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: The wine is all texture, tight apple and pear skins, the acidity suggesting green characters.
title: Terroirs et Talents 2008 Pierre Dupont Cuvée des Grenouilles  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: A soft, gentle wine with white fruit and creaminess. It's simple, crisp and fresh.
title: Château du Châtelard 2007 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: Fat, heavy in the mouth, rather lifeless wine, with light acidity and some pear juice flavors.
title: Louis Max 2008  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is a soft wine with juicy acidity, a creamy texture and a touch of crisp citrus at the end.
title: Florent Descombe NV Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: A soft wine, certainly ripe, but with a metallic edge that spoils the lime and green plum fruit flavors.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Domaine du Val Lamartinien  (Saint-Véran)

description: This is a wine with harshness, sharp walnut and bitter orange flavors. It gives off a hard feeling that probably won't soften much.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2013 Plants Carré  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Tastes like a simple varietal wine, with proper apple and peach flavors and decent acidity. Gets the job done, but don't look for layers of complexity in this one-dimensional regional wine.
title: Barton & Guestier 2000 Tradition 2000  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Starts off promising, with pretty aromas of smoke, green apples and limes, but by the finish, the amount of charred oak distracts from the plump fruit flavors that form the core of this wine.
title: Chateau de Mercey 2001 Vignes en Lyre  (Côte de Beaune)

description: A soft, dilute wine, this is gently fruity. Acidity gives a lift at the end. Drink now.
title: Pierre-Yves et Olivier Fichet 2016 La Crepillionne  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Soft, artificially perfumed, round and with a texture that is too open.
title: Maison Coron Pére et Fils 2008  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: A dirty nose spoils this otherwise attractive, easy, crisp Chablis. The palate has some notes of yeast and bright white fruit, with a citrusy finish.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2011  Chablis

description: A fruity wine, it has fresh citrus and pear flavors. It is very light with just hints of texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2012  Petit Chablis

description: The wine is candied and sherbet-flavored. Acidity gives some freshness, but it feels artificial and light.
title: Manuel Seguin 2012  Viré-Clessé

description: This is a combination of tropical fruits and tight acidity, making for an unbalanced wine that seems not to know its way.
title: Domaine Verret et Fils 2010  Chablis

description: A hollow wine, all surface and no depth. The wine is light, perhaps dilute.
title: Dominique Cornin 2008  Mâcon Chaintré

description: Very soft and dull, it offers white fruits and some acidity. Drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2012 En Paradis  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: Lacks concentration, but boasts modest apple and citrus flavors leavened by a touch of buttered sweet corn. Imported by Cannon Wines Limited.
title: Patriarche Pére et Fils 2001  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine has a soft texture. It seems unfocused, not balanced between fruit and structure.
title: Roger Luquet 2014 Bois Séguin  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This broad wine is soft, indistinct and suffers from overripe fruit. It needs a shot of acidity to give it life and interest.
title: Mommessin 2015 Grandes Mises  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Slathered with spicy oak, sweet caramel and blatant buttery notes, which largely overwhelm the modest apple and citrus fruit. If you like heavy oaking, you'll like this more than we did. Imported by Sieur d'Arques Wines.
designation: Toques et Clochers Clocher D'Ajac Reserve Jean-Pierre Bourret Vigneron
title: Sieur d'Arques 2003 Toques et Clochers Clocher D'Ajac Reserve Jean-Pierre Bourret Vigneron Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: This wine is perfumed, soft and with a light character. An oddly floral character doesn't jell with the fruitiness that is behind it.
title: Domaine Carrette 2013 Les Crays  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: While it has some attractive apple fruits, the wine misses out on the real minerality and texture of Pouilly Fuissé. It's a wine hidden behind net drapes, indistinct.
title: Pierre André 2009  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: There is a rustic edge to this flat wine. It is soft and lightly fruity although unfocused. Drink now.
title: Château de Beauregard 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Soft with a yeasty character, this wine has not gotten its act together. It has some bitterness, walnut and spice flavors although nothing hangs together.
title: Domaine Ferret 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé
Domaine Vincent Sauvestre 2003 Clos des Tessons  (Meursault)

description: Soft, without much definition, a wine that lacks acidity and freshness.
title: Domaine Ferret 2008 Tournant de Pouilly  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: It seems strange to have such a heavy, expensive bottle for a wine at this price. The soft, off-dry Chardonnay inside has a lightly fruity character, showing white fruits and the softest texture. It is easy and ready to drink.
title: Le Pépin 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Soft, light and fresh, this wine has attractive acidity as well as crisp, green flavors. There's a touch of vanilla which broadens it out. It's a solid, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2002 Cépage Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: With its distinctive enameled, flowered bottle, this sets out to be a fun party wine. It succeeds with its fresh, flowery, open fruit, enhanced by vanilla, spice and green apple flavors.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2005 Chardonnay Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Aromas of light green apple and spice open this offering. Mild lemony fruit on the palate shows a slight chalkiness, and a light, even texture keeps it clean and satisfying.
title: Calvet 1998 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A pleasing, simple Chardonnay. Mild tropical fruit and herbs mark the nose. Fruit is of medium weight, a little soft, even fat. Has decent body; flavors are just a little indistinct.
title: Barton & Guestier 1998 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A ripe and lush style of Chardonnay that's widely available, this has assertive characteristics of pineapple, mango and sweet citrus that are plentiful throughout the nose and mouth. Medium weight, with a straightforward style and a brisk, clean finish.
title: Skalli 2010 Fortant de France Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: A full, ripe unoaked Chard, from the new line of French Roots wines, this has some hazelnut and green plum flavors along with light acidity. It is soft, pleasant and ready to drink.
title: Ginestet 2005 French Roots Chardonnay Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: This unoaked Chardonnay has some sligtly nutty qualities on the nose, allied to a bit of peach. It's unabashedly ripe, a bit heavy and alcholic, but at least it offers more texture than your typical Pays d'Oc Chard. Pear and spice flavors round out the package.
title: Tortoise Creek 2003 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A hint of butteriness, grilled nuts and ripe peaches give this wine a bit of California-esque quality. It's plump and ripe in the mouth, then turns a bit tart and metallic on the finish.
title: Les Jamelles 2002 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Supple, soft fruit gives this wine a simple easy-drinking character. It's great for apéritifs, rich enough for food and just plain enjoyable.
title: Les Vignerons de la Méditerranée 2003 Réserve St. Martin Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: So light, dry and taut, you might mistake this for a Sauvignon Blanc with its grapefruit profile and high acidity. Still, the cleansing tartness is likeable, if not entirely expected. This will work as an apéritif or paired with lighter foods.
subregion: Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France
title: Herzog Selection 1999 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France)

description: A fresh, but full-bodied wine, which has aromas of citrus and sawn wood. It is ripe, smooth, with vanilla layers sandwiched between green fruits and white currants. This makes an attractive food wine for fish and white meat dishes.
title: Barton & Guestier 2002  Mâcon-Villages

description: Delicate aromas of red apple and dried grass tease on the nose of this soft wine, while slightly more assertive flavors of lime and white melon rind unfold on the medium-weight mouth. Ample acidity keeps the finish fresh, but short.
title: Barton & Guestier 2016 B&G Réserve Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: This value wine is a great choice for simple summer fair like grilled chicken salads. Light and fresh with underripe peach and mango fruit flavors accented by sweet pea florals. Drink now.
title: Arrogant Frog 2010 Lily Pad White Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: A lightweight Chardonnay, with scents of apple, earth and flinty minerality. Flavors run along the same lines, picking up riper pear notes before finishing with hints of quince. Imported by Winesellers Ltd.
title: Tortoise Creek 2004 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A decent Chard at an attractive price. Light intensity on the nose with suggestions of citrus and pear slices. The mouth is just as subtle, leading through to the short but clean finish.
title: Les Vignerons de la Méditerranée 2008 Réserve St. Martin Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: An unwooded Chardonnay that is very soft, with a touch of sweetness and flavors of citrus and green plums.
subregion: Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France
title: Remy-Pannier 2005 Vallée des Jardins Chardonnay (Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France)

description: A ripe, warm style of wine with light acidity. It has weight and spice, followed by a rich, caramel character. The vines are planted at high altitude, helping keep the freshness in the fruit.
title: Henry Fessy 2007  Beaujolais Blanc

description: A very soft, fruity wine, with a gentle, creamy texture and light acidity. It's fresh with vanilla and pear flavors, and ready to drink.
title: Cave de Lugny 2012 Floriéres  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Soft, lightly creamy Chardonnay, pleasantly fruity, offering some apple and pear flavors along with gentle acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2009  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is a soft, rounded wine with floral aromas and a line of citrusy acidity. Its light tang gives it a crisp aftertaste.
title: Patriarche Pére et Fils 2016 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Oaky notes of buttered toast, dried apple slices and baked peach are upfront in the bouquet of this wine. The palate is similarly rich and round, but with ample acidity to keep it from falling completely flat. Flavors of orange creamsicle and spiced apple linger on the close.
title: Phantom Bay 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Named after the iconic Citroën 2 CV car, this wine is soft, gently fruity without great definition. It offers some ripe apricot flavors along with touches of spice and pepper. The wine is easy, ready to drink.
title: Voiturette 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Starts off promising, with hints of roasted nuts and grilled peaches, but seems to lose steam as it goes down. Still, the modest peach and pear flavors finish smoothly.
title: J. & F. Lurton 2003 Les Salices Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Lemon and Anjou pear take the lead in this easy-drinking white, with secondary hints of faint toast and citrus rind adding depth and interest. It's balanced but there's a slight sharpness to the finish with a slightly pithy bitterness.
title: The Frenchhouse 2010 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Light, lean citrus and toasted apple chips drive the nose of this Chard, with a hint of yellow floral character unfolding in the medium- weight but slightly hot mouth.
title: The Frenchhouse 2009 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A simple but easy-to-drink Chardonnay with soft aromas and flavors of ripe red apple and pear. Medium weight with a solid, clean finish.
title: Barton & Guestier 2007 Bistro Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A soft, smooth, apples-and-cream-flavored wine, shot with acidity and some green fruit. It's a light wine, very crisp and clean, better with food than as an apéritif.
subregion: Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France
title: Remy-Pannier 2006 Vallée des Jardins Chardonnay (Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France)

description: A rounded, very soft Chardonnay from Chablis producer Simmonet-Febvre. There are green fruits, with hints of pears and light acidity. The edge of green tannin gives the wine some shape, but it is essentially soft. Screwcap.
region: Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée
subregion: Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2006 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée)

description: Subtle peach and toast scents on the nose, with pretty peach shadings on the palate that seems a little light and diffuse. Finishes short.
title: Antonin Rodet 2001  Bourgogne

description: Blends apple and citrus together in pleasing, if somewhat simple, whole. Drink now.
title: Louis Jadot 2001  Mâcon-Villages

description: Suggestions of dried white flowers accent the ripe Anjou pear and melon aromas. Round and flush in the mouth, the fruit flavors are ripe and lend heft to the weighty finish. Drink now.
title: Le Drunk Rooster 2010 Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: Look for the 2010 vintage of this wine, as the 2009 seems a bit tired now with muted notes of melon rind and lemon in the round mouth and a finish that shows a bit of heat.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2009 Cadet d'Oc Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Candied lemon, vanilla custard and sweet orange oil all abound thoughout. With 35,000 cases imported, this straightforward quaffer should be easy to find and should please most who enjoy a fuller-bodied and oak-driven Chard.
title: Hob Nob 2008 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Toast crumbs, soft hay and green apple skin appear in the bouquet, while flavors of lime and apple flesh fill the medium-weight mouth with a short but clean close.
title: Mont Tauch 2009 Le Dog de Charlotte Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: This is simple, fresh and crisply clean Chardonnay. It has melon, lemon and green apple flavors that come together into a fruity, light wine. Ready to drink now.
subregion: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire
title: Rémy Luneau 2010 Domaine de la Grange Chardonnay (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)

description: A fresh and fruity simple Bourgogne blanc, with hints of honey layered atop pear and apple fruit. Crisp on the finish; try as an apéritif.
title: Prosper Maufoux 2004  Bourgogne

description: Light in body, with apple, peach and citrus notes on the nose and in the mouth. Very cleanly made, this is a solid introduction to white Burgundy at a good price.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2003 Laforet  (Bourgogne)

description: While the aromas and flavors offer similar notes of underripe peaches and pencilly oak, the finish turns tart and grapefruity. It's pleasant enough, just a bit austere on its own; lean fish with a citrus preparation could help soften it.
title: Mommessin 2001 La Clé Saint Pierre  (Bourgogne)

description: Bland and soft, this has light and gently tangy fruit with apple and lime flavors. The aftertaste is fresh. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Mâcon-Villages

description: Soft and ripe, this is Chardonnay at its simplest. It has melon and pear flavors, light acidity and a rounded texture. Drink this easy wine now.
title: Le Petit Panier 2012 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Mealy apple and orange custard aromas set the stage for this ripe, fleshy white. There's a roundness to the mouthfeel, as those notes continue through to the palate, though the finish offers a pithy citrus astringency that helps to enliven the experience.
title: Domaine Saint-Nabor 2016 Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: This medium- weight Chard shows some grass and green plum notes alongside riper accents of apple and honeysuckle. Might be past its prime; try the 2010.
title: La Noble 2009 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: An interesting Chard that offers quite sweet notes of stewed peaches, orange marmalade and overripe honeydew. Big and a bit clumsy in the mouth, more vibrancy and freshness is needed to keep things in better balance. However, if you like 'em sweeter, this one's for you.
title: Domaine de Guiot 2008 Les Jumeaux Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: This soft, tank-aged wine has attractive apple fruits, a touch of citrus and crisp acidity. Light and fruity, it is ready to drink.
title: Bernier 2014 Chardonnay (Val de Loire)

description: This is a soft wine, light and fresh. It has a citrus character, lemon squeezed over apples that give crispness. Some minerality to the texture adds interest and puts the wine in the food-friendly category. Drink now.
title: Château de Pizay 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

description: Soft Chardonnay, with pear and walnut flavors, light acidity and rounded buttery flavors. There is an attractive final richness.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2009 Laforet  (Bourgogne)

description: While this wine is full, it has an indistinct character. A soft texture and only light fruitiness leave a dull impression.
title: Gerald Talmard 2016  Mâcon-Chardonnay

description: Slightly doughy or nutty on the nose, this wine then opens up on the palate to reveal more citrus and tropical fruit flavors. Medium-bodied, with a finish that's short but fresh. Imported by Cannon Wines Limited.
title: Patriarche Pére et Fils 2004  Mâcon-Villages

description: With a light structure and some minerality, this is an attractive, textured wine. Flavors of apples, citrus fruits and a note of caramel pair with its zesty character that lends an attractive finishing bite.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2010  Mâcon-Villages

description: Light, rather indistinct wine. It has some green apple fruit, green pepper and bitter almonds. The style is clean, attenuated, although simple and balanced at the end.
title: Labouré-Roi 2010 St Amand  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Tart, clean and fresh, with fruit reminiscent of underripe pineapple. With its lingering acidic finish, it's probably best served with raw oysters or clams.
title: La Chablisienne 2001  Petit Chablis

description: Minor hints of red apple flesh, creamed orange and straw dance softly on the nose of this direct white. There's some weight to the midpalate despite the low intensity of citrus-based flavors. Drink now.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2016 Aussiéres Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: Sometimes it's nice to sip a Chard that's not bursting with overripe fruit and dripping with oak. This simple little country style wine has flavors of minerals and peaches, and turns firm and crisp on the finish.
title: Barton & Guestier 2000 French Tom Private Collection Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: This is a soft, gentle and ripe Chardonnay by Laurent Perrachon, current winemaker from a Beaujolais family making wine since 1877. Lemon acidity is submerged by the warm apricot and white peach flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Mouilles 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

designation: Chateau des Jacques-Grand Clos de Loyse
title: Louis Jadot 1999 Chateau des Jacques-Grand Clos de Loyse  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is billed as the only Chardonnay planted in the coastal Landes region (not a difficult claim). It is soft, ripe and easygoing in character with a hint of citrus and acidity. Drink now.
title: Laudet 2014 Laballe Le Chardonnay des Landes Chardonnay (Cotes de Gascogne)

description: Light, creamed apple fruits with a bright line of fresh acidity. The wine is exuberant in its citrus character, just broadened by an underlay of green apples.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2008 Buissonnier  (Bourgogne)

description: This wine is soft, ripe but with enough crisp fruitiness to make it refreshing. The wine dances on the palate with a light, aromatic aftertaste.
title: Pierre Merguey 2013  Mâcon-Uchizy

description: This soft wine is full of citrus and spice flavors. A lightly zesty edge brings out the acidity. Fruity and easy to drink, it is ready now.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: This soft wine is open, rounded with a balance between fruit and crisp acidity. Simple and gentle, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2016 Tradition  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This rounded, creamy wine is attractive, with rich apricots and balanced zesty acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Verchéres 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is soft and fruity, with attractive acidity that cuts into the smooth texture. It does have a nutty, bitter character that shows through, giving a hard edge to the otherwise fruity wine.
title: Cave des Vignerons de Mancey 2013 Domaine des Vercheres  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Open, soft, creamy, along with a candied fruit character. There is freshness here, with the acidity dominant on the finish.
title: Signé Vigneron 2008  Mâcon-Villages

description: The warm vineyard of Vinzelles produces a broad ripe wine. It has yellow fruits, a soft texture that is spiced with pepper. The wine is generous, rounded, smooth and ready to drink.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2015 Solaire  (Mâcon-Vinzelles)

description: Light weight but a bit flat in the mouth with notes of sour stone fruit and crunchy red apple leading into a softly spiced finish.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2009 Réserve Spéciale Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Very soft, very clean, a little neutral, this wine has apricot and green plum flavors, touches of toast. It is fresh, rounded and soft, neatly finished with acidity and a fruit skin texture.
title: Les Vins Skalli 2005 Robert Skalli South of France Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Pleasant, pale, fairly thin and tart, with lemony fruit and a simple finish.
title: Louis Latour 1998  Chablis

description: Quite lean citrus, nut and anise aromas announce this crisp, briskly acidic white. The wine shows some positive aromas and flavors and has a long finish, but the lemon and vanilla elements cannot overcome the fairly piercing sharpness.
title: Michel Picard 1995 Domaine Champs Perdix  (Rully)

description: Fresh Chardonnay, lightly warm but also tinged with acidity, citrus and pear flavors. Soft, creamy and friendly. Drink now.
title: Vins Auvigue 2006 Le Moulin du Pont  (Saint-Véran)

description: This textured, mineral Chardonnay has fresh apple and strong citrus flavors. It is lively, crisp and ready to drink. The producer is a member of Terroirs Originels of Beaujolais and Burgundy's Mâcon.
title: Domaine Emmanuel Fellot 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

description: One of the rare white wine produced in Beaujolais from Chardonnay. This is fresh with an attractive mineral content, touches of lemon and a ripe final aftertaste.
title: Paul Beaudet 2010 Domaine Romy  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: Crisp and clean, with simple green-apple aromas. More interesting in the mouth, where it blends citrus with apple and melon. Drink now.
title: Domaine Vessigaud 2001  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: Initially closed, this wine soon reveals a crisp, zesty texture and flavors of citrus and green apple. With its minerally character, Mâcon-Fuissé is a sort of poor man's Pouilly-Fuissé, although it often shows more softness.
title: Domaine Luquet 2011  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: Pleasant, but characterless wine, it has soft structure, some light green fruits and a final hint of toast. Screwcap.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrétes 2008 Domaine Perraud Vieilles Vignes  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Soft and fruity, this is a gentle, creamy wine. Almond and quince flavors are spread generously over the ripe texture. Drink now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2013 Buissonier  (Montagny)

description: Lightweight wine that seems somewhat dilute with flavors of green plums, bright acidity and a very soft texture.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2008  Petit Chablis

description: Hard-edged wine, with wood flavors dominant over the steely fruit character. It is very structured, perhaps too much.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrétes 2008 Cuvée Delaye les Pierres Grises  (Saint-Véran)

description: Soft and fruity, this is a rounded, simple wine. It has apple and light spice and a gentle texture that is already approachable. Juicy and fresh, not a wine for aging, it is ready to drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Les Enfants Terribles Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: This Chardonnay from Marcel Grillet's horse-plowed biodynamic vineyard called Pizay is still very young, showing a candy, confected flavor that needs to calm down. It has the potential for attractive fruit from 2016.
title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

description: This Chardonnay is soft, with attractive and gentle green fruit and sliced-apple flavors. A tang of lemon juice gives extra freshness.
title: Domaine Dupeuble Pére et Fils 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

description: Fresh and fruity, this has a ripe apricot character that contrasts the mineral acidity and bright fruit character. The wine dances lightly and is now ready to drink.
title: Michel Picard 2009  Bourgogne

description: While the creamy fruit is attractive, this is a light wine, with a touch of pear and apple flavors.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2010 Tiserny  (Bourgogne)

description: A light and softly fruity wine, its acidity giving a lift to the yellow fruits and toast that rounds out the acidity. Clean and attractive.
title: Louis Chevallier 2009  Bourgogne

description: A hint of sulfur on the nose doesn't stop some green apple and pear aromas from making a positive impression. But the wine is light in weight, featuring a hint of sweetness to the underlying flavors of underripe fruit.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Pére et Fils 2001  Chablis
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Pére et Fils

description: Soft and broad, a little unfocused, the fruit showing pear juice and green apple skins. It feels light, juicy, missing concentration, and there's a caramel toast aftertaste.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2008 Buissonnier Côte Chalonnaise Chardonnay  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: Fresh, bright wine that feels light in texture and weight. That makes it suited for shellfish rather than more intense dishes. Attractive, ready to drink.
title: Manuel Olivier 2008  Hautes Cotes de Nuits

description: This tight wine lacks fruit. Touches of apple and citrus are lost in the austere texture. No artificial yeasts were used during vinification in stainless steel and large oak barrels.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014  Macon-Bussiéres

description: This soft, light wine has hints of citrus and acidity. It is fruity, crisp and bright with orange zest at the end. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Pére et Fils 2016 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: Attractive rich Chardonnay, balancing creamy fruit flavors against acidity. It does have some freshness, the acidity giving an apple edge to the softness. For drinking now.
title: Jaffelin 2009 Les Chapitres de Jaffelin  (Bourgogne)

description: This is fairly big and full-bodied for Chablis, with a golden hue and aromas of dried spices that suggest it might have seen a little time in oak. The fruit takes a back seat to notes of earth and spice.
title: Michel Picard 2001  Chablis

description: Soft and rounded, almost with some sweetness, this is a light, simple wine. It has some apple and melon flavors, lined with acidity. Drink now.
title: Jaffelin 2009  Chablis

description: This has some freshness, with red-apple flavors, light and green. There's a spoiling touch of sulfur, probably the result of recent bottling.
title: Labouré-Roi 2005 Chablis Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This wine offers attractive citrus and yellow-fruit flavors. It is fresh, with a richer backdrop of perfumed fruit. The texture brings out the ripeness.
title: Christophe Cordier 2014  Mâcon

description: Mâcon-Péronne is one of the smaller Mâcon villages, producing soft, apple and cream wines. There is an attractive touch of bright citrus acidity to go with this rounded, open wine.
title: Jaffelin 2009 Les Villages de Jaffelin  (Mâcon-Péronne)

description: This wine is herbal, almost too crisp, with tight citrus flavors. The taste of lemon dominates, giving a wine packed with acidity.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Lemoir  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Smooth and round, this wine has hints of yellow fruits, touches of citrus and simple bright fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017  Mâcon-Villages

description: Bright and fruity, this wine is light, crisp and shot through with acidity. Lively and tangy, it's ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Perraud 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: This soft, gentle wine has some attractive citrus and apple fruits. Easy to drink, it offers a crisp tangy aftertaste. It is not a wine for aging, so drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Collection  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This soft, open wine has a light fruit character with attractive acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Marie Challand 2012 Les Tilles  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Very light, flavored with fruit drops and pear juice, this feels soft, verging on dilute. Yes, there are some easy fruity flavors, but the acidity is missing and the wine is unstructured. Imported by Wilson Daniels Ltd.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2006  Mâcon-Villages

description: Citrusy and crisp, with limes playing a dominant role in the aromas and flavors. Light and refreshing.
title: F. Chauvenet 2001  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Warm and round, this has a generous character, while missing some of the attractive crispness of the vintage. It is ready to drink now, soft and fruity.
title: Château La Greffiére 2014  Saint-Véran

description: Tight, acidic and very crisp, it's propelled forward by lemon zest and grapefruit flavors. It is bright, fruity and light in texture.
title: Pierre André 2012  Saint-Véran

description: Thin, dilute wine. It has clean fruit, some white pear juice, light acidity, but boring.
title: Louis Max 2008  Saint-Véran

description: An ill-defined wine, closed and tight, this just hints at fruit without showing much intensity. The aftertaste has some bright lemon zest texture.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2013  Viré-Clessé

description: This example shows a bit more character than many Pays d'Oc Chardonnays. Pretty scents of lemon and honeysuckle lead to a palate with above-average concentration and lovely lemon meringue pie flavors. Tangy acidity renders this a good choice for salmon.
title: Robert Skalli 2005 South of France Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Without any wood aging, the wine shows just the yeastiness from aging on the lees. That fills the palate with spice and a touch of pepper. The wine needs a little more time. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Sauvat 2015 Anthéus Chardonnay (Cotes d'Auvergne)

description: Soft and ripe, this is a fruity wine with apple and pear flavors that are lightly enhanced by the juicy, refreshing acidity. The finish is lively and fragrant. Screwcap.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2010  Bourgogne

description: Heavily wooded, this is a wine in which the toastiness is too much for the fruit. You can feel the weight, with hints of white fruits, but all that wood is just too much. Imported by Wilson Daniels Ltd.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2006  Bourgogne

description: This simple wine has some attractive citrus fruit. It is light, bright with plenty of acidity to keep it all fresh. It should be drunk now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Domaine des Chéneviéres  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: A simple, fruity wine, this offers attractive citrus flavors and a ripe texture. Yellow fruits add richness while the acidity shoots through at the end.
title: Domaine Chatelain 2013  Petit Chablis

description: Noticeable caramel aromas, the wine honeyed, toasty, buttered. It tastes very round and soft, not much more.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2008  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This is a soft, gently fruity and very lightly textured wine. It is perfumed with creamed apple flavors and some fresh acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Jaffelin 2013 Les Chapitres de Jaffelin  (Bourgogne)

description: Round and softly fruity, this white Burgundy comes with a hint of vanilla. With its ripe apple, lime and yellow fruit flavors, it's instantly drinkable. The finish is touched by acidity.
title: Jaffelin 2010 Les Chapitres de Jaffelin  (Bourgogne)

description: Grand Ordinaire is the most basic of Burgundy's appellations, from outlying vineyards. Within that parameter, Bertrand Ambroise produces a light, fresh, citrus- and fresh pineapple-flavored wine, ready-to-drink with a touch of green apple skins to give structure. Screwcap. Imported by Robert Kacher Imports.
title: Bertrand Ambroise 2007 Lettre d'Eloïse Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Grand Ordinaire)

description: This is a generous, rounded and very perfumed wine. Candy and bubble gum flavors give sweetness that contrasts with the acidity.
title: Demessey 2012 Château de Messey Les Crets  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)

description: Almond flavors and a touch of bitterness give this wine a hard edge. It has spice, pepper and good acidity, although there is not enough fruit to go around.
title: Domaine Carrette 2013 Les Mûres  (Saint-Véran)

description: With flavors of vanilla and caramel, this is rounded and full in the mouth. It passes up on a steely, edgy texture in favor of a warm and rich character. The result is a wine that is soft and needs to be drunk now.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2013 Le Classique  (Chablis)

description: Opens with a lean nose of green apple, light vanilla and herbs. In the mouth it shows smoke, green tea and a touch of sweetness. Light body, crisp mouthfeel. Clean finish with a slight chalkiness. Good, if a bit light.
title: Michel Picard 1997  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This open, fruity wine has a soft side. Apples and pears are prominent along with a touch of spice. Drink now.
designation: Domaine de la Chapelle Les Perriers
title: Pascal Rollet 2014 Domaine de la Chapelle Les Perriers  (Saint-Véran)

description: Somewhat earthy and rustic, this is a fresh wine, with citrus notes and some yeastiness. The wine's fruit has finishing liveliness and crispness.
title: Domaine Grossot 2005  Chablis

description: This wine is soft and very rich. That takes away from the fruit and leaves a broad wine, smooth and with a touch of pepper from alcohol. It is too big.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine de la Garenne  (Macon-Bussiéres)

description: This fresh, soft and simple wine has attractive acidity. Fruity and aromatic, it is totally ready to drink.
title: Cave de Lugny 2013 Coeur de Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: Light and bright, this fruity wine has a more bitter element that gives a sharper character that will hopefully round out. At the back, plenty of acidity leaves a crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine Saumaize-Michelin 2013  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is a soft, rounded wine, with ripe fruit that seems unfocused. The fruit and the acidity are reticent, not giving the wine much shape. A simple, ripe wine, it can be drunk now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Montagny)

description: This soft wine has ripe melon and pear flavors only lightly cut with citrus acidity. It is easy to drink and ready now.
title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2014 Domaine des Vieux Murs  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Soft and bland, hollow in the center, showing a crisp, textured aftertaste.
title: Collin-Bourisset 2008 Rive Droite  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Toast and a yeast character gives an edge of bitterness to the fruit. There are hints of smooth melon and acidity, although the lightly burnt character masks the fruitiness.
title: Chanson Pére et Fils 2013  Viré-Clessé

description: Crisp with an edge of honey, this is a ripe and fruity wine. Along with apple and cantaloupe melon flavors it has a nutty character and some light acidity, both of which add to its simple attraction. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013  Bourgogne

description: A creamy, vanilla- and ripe fruit-flavored wine. Apricot and melon fruit flavors dominate, with new wood and a delicate layer of crisp, clean acidity. Drink now.
title: Maison Champy 2006 Signature  (Bourgogne)

description: This is a basic Chablis, soft and fruity. Apples and pear skin flavors have a burst of acidity, a light mineral texture and a juicy aftertaste. It is ready to drink.
title: Louis Jadot 2013  Chablis

description: This soft wine focuses on white fruits, pears and a creamy texture. The acidity is there, with a touch of minerality, but with its simple, easy flavors, this makes a great aperitif.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Pére et Fils 2006  Chablis
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Pére et Fils

description: Soft and round, this has gentle fruitiness and a touch of spice. It is an easy, open wine that is ready to drink.
title: Manciat-Poncet 2014 Les Crays  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
La Chablisienne 2003 Côte de Léchet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Fresh and light in character, this fruity, crisp wine is up front with its bright character. Tight, fragrant and ready to drink, it is a simple wine that will be good as an apéritif.
title: Domaine Normand 2013  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse

description: This wine has soft fruit, a creamy texture and light acidity. It is balanced, fruity with apple and spice flavors. The aftertaste introduces a drier, woody character that is less attractive.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Round and fruity, this offers gentle acidity and ripe melon fruit. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Bouchard Aîné et Fils 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine is missing great depth of flavor. It has bright acidity and hints of peach fruit flavors, but remains dull.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2012  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Showing just a few hints of minerals and crispness, this Chablis is so very light. It has some citrus and green-plum flavors along with flashes of acidity. The aftertaste is surprisingly soft for such a young wine.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Chablis)

description: This wine is so light, it is almost insubstantial. Hints of white fruit float across the surface, backed up by acidity and a gentle, fresh character. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Michel-Andreotti 2013 Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: Crisp and light, this is a bright wine with attractive acidity and fresh fruitiness. It's not a wine for the long-term, with its simple caramel and spice flavors. Drink now.
title: Domaine Paquet et Fils 2013 Château de Chaintré  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Tropical in character, this wine has soft acidity and an attractive texture. With ripe mango flavor, it's full in the mouth and ready to drink.
title: Jean-Marie Challand 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This is a tight wine that has as much texture as fruit. It yields a wine that has some bitterness and a hard, zesty finish.
title: Domaine Daniel Dugois 2010 Mouchets Chardonnay (Arbois)

description: The wine is dull, without great character other than some light fruitiness and a hint of wood aging. Drink now.
title: Bouchard Pére & Fils 2012  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Freshness is the hallmark of this attractively crisp, apple-flavored wine. The lightness of texture manages to retain some good green plum skin, apricot and lively acidity. The finish is pure, clean, slightly honeyed.
title: Domaine Pommier 2007  Petit Chablis

description: This wine is fat and flabby, with a soft texture and light fruitiness. It has weight but lacks definition.
title: Trénel 2017  Saint-Véran

description: A year can make a big difference in a marginal climate like Chablis, and this 2001 doesn't show the charm of the 2002s. Lean, hard and tart, marked by lime and flint aromas and flavors.
title: Domaine Laroche 2001 Les Vaudevey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Soft and ripe, this Chablis has white fruit and citrus flavors. The palate reveals a yeasty character that intrudes on the fresh fruit.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2011  Chablis

description: This wine is very soft and only lightly fruity. Some spice and touches of acidity give a crisp edge to the otherwise dull wine.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Mercurey)

description: Delicate smoke and pear aromas give way to a palate that lacks flavor and intensity. Overzealous yields are almost certainly the culprit here. The finish is decent, but disappointing for the price.
title: Moillard 1997  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Smooth and generous, this wine is soft and missing any bite. It is round and unfocused, but ready to drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Le Clos Devouluet Durand-les-Verchés  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Pleasant, soft wine, easy to drink, its fruits round and somewhat dilute. It doesn't resonate, but is certainly fresh and crisp.
title: Domaine Jayer-Gilles 2007  Bourgogne Hautes Cotes de Beaune

description: Soft, spiced with plenty of toast, offering just hints of fruit. The wood has too much weight for the fruit.
title: Domaine Ferret 2008 Le Clos Tête de Cru  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Soft and rich, the wine lacks real definition. It is ripe and full with wood and tropical fruit flavors, but missing acidity.
title: Château de Beauregard 2008 La Maréchaude  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This still white wine from the Champagne region is produced from one parcel of old Chardonnay vines. With spicy wood aromas, and dominant wood flavors, the actual taste of the fruit is hard to discern. There's intense acidity. A curiosity, and a reminder that Champagne is better sparkling.
title: J. de Telmont 2003 Insolite Chardonnay (Coteaux Champenois)

description: Scents of cooked apples mingle with smoke and minerals on the nose. Lacks the power of Corton-Charlemagne, instead delivering apple and citrus flavors in a medium-weight format. Well-made but hard and ungenerous on the finish. Imported by Royal Wine Corporation.
title: Francois Labet 2002  Corton-Charlemagne
